description: This course studies 8 to 10 Japanese films by well-known directors such as Ozu, Kurosawa
and Itami. Consideration is taken of the way in which their angle of vision affects the development
of themes, such as the conflict between duty and feeling, the sense of family, or satire of the
family. Includes both historical samurai films and contemporary social problem films. Offered
fullname: Introduction to Japanese Film (in English translation)
